p.text: For clients in the food industry requiring interactive platforms and tools, Spoon is a custom software developer providing new, innovative and useful food-based software solutions.
By fully understanding the client and the market expectations, we aim to provide novel products with real consumer value.
e-Cook: An interactive cookbook software for students.
Display recipes with video, audio instructions.

As a young company of students who have grown up with technology we feel like we can bring plenty of novel ideas to the table, exploiting the user interfaces and processing power of modern consumer technology.
: Talented and dedicated employees with real-world experience in software engineering.
: New business; currently with limited funding.
: The digital market remains relatively unexplored in terms of cooking aids.
Our technology will be ready for future smart appliance integration .
Each module will require an estimated 5 weeks' worth of labour and overhead; £9375 + £712.5 = £10,087.50
We must buy at least two modules to complete the product within the time constraint.
Spoon uses the Agile method of software development and progress is tracked using a cloud-based Kanban board.
Customer fueled promotion via social media
In the near future we see ourselves as a firmly established and competitive company in the market; always delivering quality products on time and on budget.
We aim for products to be integrated into every kitchen environment because of their competitive pricing, usability and longevity.
A share of hosted package recipes bought by consumers
Software modules sold to other companies
Users will be able to add their personal notes to the recipes. More fitting to their personal tastes
Users can set multiple timers for different cooking functions simultaneously
Users can adjust ingredient quantities for the number of guests
Ingredients can exported and printed to a physical copy
Users will be able to "share" recipes with friends and family through social media
The next big software product in cooking and kitchen techniques for students.
Strategies taken to optimize costs include:
Careful consideration of testing and implementation
Most cookbook software provides all the recipes in a single jumble.
No graphical theme just simple, minimalistic design and colour scheme.
Method of providing user feedback (Positive, Minor Pains & Errors).
All of the participants surveyed were interested in eating healthier and on a budget.
A survey of our primary market, university students, showed 77% prefer a cookbook software to a regular cookbook or web resource.
Chefs gets promotional value from submitting their recipes.
Designed to be healthy, easy and cheap so all can benefit not just students.
